creator: christophe.thibaut@cgi.com
text:
I use a servlet deployed on WebSphere 4.0 to generate a PDF.
The XSL used to generate contains an image (a JPG file).

The first time I call the servlet, the document seems to be generated correctly 
execpt for the image. I have the following Acrobat message when the PDF is 
displayed : "L'image de Form, de type 3 ou de motif est trop grande" and the 
image is not displayed.

That the first problem.

But when i call the servlet a second time and for all the next time, the PDF 
generated contains NOTHING ....

Note :
* The programm run perfectly on TOMCAT
* In the log I found several line as following :
   illegal char value -17
   illegal char value -30
* If I suppress the image in the XSL, it works fine

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11277 ***
